WRITING.TITLE: Can't decide whether I hate myself or love myself for making this... I think it's a little of both.

WRITING.TEXT: Well, my uncle is a district attorney, yet he buys me drinks at restaurants (especially in Las Vegas) and stuff all the time. I'm 17, almost 18, and he has been doing this since I was like 15 I think. Drinking age here (USA) is 21.
It's different every time.

Not a parent, but I was at the orthopedist waiting to get my foot checked out (in the waiting room), and there was a couple with an adorable daughter who was probably about 4 or 5 years old. There was a man on crutches walking out of one of the rooms, and he tripped over a chair that was sort of sticking out. Then the little girl shouts, "WHAT A DUMBASS!" She was grinning, and her parents were silently cracking up. The mom then shushed her and said, "Honey, where'd you hear that word?" And the little girl just kept on grinning. The guy on crutches luckily found it pretty funny.
Supernatural... Shit.

'Smultronstlle' (pronounced smUl-tron-'stel-e) is the Swedish word for "'place of wild strawberries'; a special place discovered, treasured, returned to for solace and relaxation; a personal idyll free from stress or sadness"
STUDENT LOANS. TAXES. OOOooooooOoooooo!
That Jackass 3D movie that came out in 2010. I saw it with my dad in the movie theatre. Advice: Don't.
American here. Canada is basically our BFF. IF YOU FUCK WITH CANADA, YOU FUCK WITH US.
Sarah Sucksdickformoney

Once, I went on a field trip to Knott's Berry Farm in elementary school, and on the way back, we stopped at Hometown Buffet. I had the pleasure of watching some random kid puke up mashed potatoes and mac n cheese on the floor right by the entrance. I haven't been back to HTB since.
Mr. Meaty. I would freak out whenever it came on. Also, that one Nosferatu episode of Spongbob freaked me the fuck out t the end. Also, Courage the Cowardly Dog kind of disturbed me.
http://imgur.com/MP9rDjn

A friend of mine (M) used to sleep walk when he was around the age of 10-ish. Our families were in the Bahamas on vacation, and L (my friend, M's sister) and I were watching something in TV. They were in a pretty big suite at Atlantis, and all of a sudden, M calmly walks into the room (in his sleep), stops, and then starts screaming and running all over the room. Then he started banging on the doors and windows and walls saying, "WE NEED TO GET OUT OF HERE, THERE'S SHARKS! MOOOOM! MOOOOOOM!" And meanwhile, L, L's mom, and I are calmly following him everywhere he goes, very amused. He then suddenly stopped, stared into space, and then calmly got back in bed.
**TL;DR: Friend sleep-RAN all over the hotel room whilst going ballistic.**

Not a tattoo artist, but one of my friends is and one time she tattooed a camel on some guy's big toe. Even funnier, I later found out that the guy who got the tattoo is actually a different friend's half brother.

This one is my joke, but all my friends thought it was pretty funny. For an explanation, I've been wearing a walking boot for a few weeks because I hurt my foot from [aerial dance](http://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aerial_dance): So, I sprained my foot doing aerial... But that's ok, she was worth it.
Are you from Iraq? Because I like the way you Baghdad ass up.

American here, in my senior year of high school. Everyone treats them as they treat everyone else. Last year, two of my friends (a lesbian couple) wound up winning homecoming queens (they got the most votes from the school out of all 4 grades). I'm secretary of my school's gay straight alliance and everyone totally supports it. My school is very supportive, even though I live in an area with the stereotype of bratty rich kids.
"I know you are, but what am I?"

Zip lining. Those cables hold several hundred pounds of weight (if not a couple thousand). The carabiners are extremely strong and it's pretty damn difficult to unclip them. I guess maybe it depends *where* you're zip lining (I've only ever gone in Hawaii, and I'm not a professional, but I've learned quite a bit). This is just what I was told by the pros.

I was 14. I was stressed, depressed, had terrible anxiety, was constantly getting into horrible verbal fights with my parents, was in a play at the time and was failing to memorize lines (and therefore letting down the rest of the cast), and just feeling absolutely worthless.
And now? 17 and I'm actually pretty damn happy with my life, besides having some lingering problems with self harm and an eating disorder. But otherwise, great! A stay in the hospital for a week and antidepressants ad anti anxiety meds have certainly helped a lot.
Half a slice of whole grain bread with low fat cream cheese and blueberries. If you're aiming for a low cal breakfast, it's a great choice - it's delicious!
The opening riff to Dammit by blink-182. I rock out every time I hear it!
So if I were to apply for an unpaid internship at sourcefed, how would I do so? Were you an intern when you first started at SF?
Are you gonna be uploading videos to your personal channel every so often?
Watched my friend puke all over the host's $6000 leather couch. This happened not five minutes after I accidentally knocked a picture frame off the wall, which shattered at my feet.
